thread.title: Lawyers demand release of Euribor rate-rigging report
thread.title_full: Lawyers demand release of Euribor rate-rigging report

title: Lawyers demand release of Euribor rate-rigging report
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Lawyers demand release of Euribor rate-rigging report The European Commission has been asked to give details of a settlement with Barclays and seven other banks Simon Dawson/Bloomberg/Getty Google+ 1 of 1 The European Commission has been asked to give details of a settlement with Barclays and seven other banks Simon Dawson/Bloomberg/Getty Harry Wilson City Editor Published at 12:01AM, October 5 2015 
The European Commission is under pressure to release details of a €1.8 billion rate-rigging settlement with eight banks, amid complaints that the authorities have still not said what the lenders did wrong, almost two years after the fines were agreed. 
Lawyers for businesses with millions of pounds in claims against banks over the manipulation of Euribor, the benchmark rate that banks in Europe charge to lend to each other, said that they were concerned that the commission had not published a final notice. 
This would set out the detail of the wrongdoing of institutions, including Barclays and Royal Bank of Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe ‘Fear biggest defence against new crisis’ Published at 12:01AM, October 5 2015

One of Britain’s leading fund managers has urged the prime minister to lead the country out of Europe if he cannot deliver fundamental reforms Equiniti lines up for £400m London float Published at 12:01AM, October 3 2015 
The company which pays pensions to millions of former civil servants is set to go public in a deal that could value the business at £700m PPI victims face 2018 claims deadline Last updated at 11:38PM, October 2 2015 
The proposed spring 2018 date by the FCA would end the long-running saga of mis-sold PPI which banks have set aside £27bn to cover Sponsored Editorial
